title: Regulation (EEC) No 1076/71 of the Council of 25 May 1971 on the compensatory amount on imports of certain oils and fats provided for in the first subparagraph of Article 3 (6) of Regulation No 136/66/EEC
header:
REGULATION (EEC) No 1076/71 OF THE COUNCIL  of 25 May 1971  on the compensatory amount on imports of certain oils and fats provided for in the first subparagraph of Article 3 (6) of Regulation No 136/66/EEC
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The compensatory amount referred to in the first and third subparagraphs of Article 3 (6) of Regulation No 136/66/EEC shall, subject to the other conditions laid down in the above-mentioned subparagraphs, be fixed only under the conditions specified in the following Articles.

The compensatory amount may be fixed only at the  1OJ No 172, 30.9.1966, p. 3025/66. 2OJ No L 275, 19.12.1970, p. 5.
level and for the length of time strictly necessary to prevent prejudice or the threat of prejudice to the interests of Community producers.
The compensatory amount shall be adjusted to take account of the situation.

The compensatory amount shall be fixed in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 38 of Regulation No 136/66/EEC. However, if the interests of the Community necessitate immediate action, the Commission may fix a compensatory amount which shall be valid for a period of not more than fifteen days.

Detailed rules for the application of this Regulation may be adopted in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 38 of Regulation No 136/66/EEC.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 25 May 1971.
For the Council
The President
M. COINTAT
